paper.title: A General Framework for Knowledge Compilation
paper.venue: PDK '91 Proceedings of the International Workshop on Processing Declarative Knowledge
paper.abstract: Computational efficiency is a central concern in the design of knowledge representation systems. In order to obtain efficient systems it has been suggested that one should limit the form of the statements in the knowledge base or use an incomplete inference mechanism. The former approach is often too restrictive for practical applications, whereas the latter leads to uncertainty about exactly what can and cannot be inferred from the knowledge base. We present a third alternative, in which knowledge given in a general representation language is translated (compiled) into a tractable form â€” allowing for efficient subsequent query answering.
